NODE.title: nsh Help
NODE.field:
nsh Commands

The Everything nsh (node shell) command line is a simple command line interface for moving and deleting nodes, or changing "directories" to a new location.

Note that only the 'cd' command works on non-[location] nodes. This is to limit "mistakes", like doing an 'rm' in the wrong location.

cd
Works just like the UNIX 'cd' command. The root directory "/" is defined by the "root_location" setting in [system settings].

rm
Works similarly to the UNIX 'rm' command. It takes a space separated list of node names. If the node name has spaces, you will need to quote the name with double or single quotes. This also accecpts wild card matching with '*' (ie 'rm node*' will remove all nodes that have a title that begins with 'node'). This only affects the nodes in the current location.

mv
Again, this behaves similar to the UNIX 'mv' command. It takes a space separated list of node names. The list is the same as 'rm'.
